channel.title: Quick Question
channel.description:
If one quart of cleaning solution will clean 7,200 square inches of surface, how many quarts will be required to clean 1,500 cylinders? Round your answer to the nearest quart.
Surface Area of cylinder = 16.48 in3
What I got: 16.48x1,500 = 24,720in2 24,720/7,200 = 3 quarts
Can anyone confirm? If it isn't right please show me the steps to correction.

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Yeah what you did was correct.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

1 Quart cleans 7,200 sq in of surface area
Surface area of one cylinder is 16.48in3

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

If they’re talking about the entire cylinder then you need the height of it.

Unless you’ve missed part of the question out and it can be considered as a 1 inch thick disc. If this was the case you’d just do what I did above.
[hr]

owait sorry brainfart.

Your original method is correct, for some reason I thought the surface area was just the area of the top of the cylinder.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick Question
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“inertia, post:2, topic:327907”]How much of the cylinder is cleaned? Just the top? Top and bottom?

Both sides:
16.4815002 = 49440
49440 / 7200 = 8 quarts

or if it’s just one side then yes your method is correct.[/quote]
I’m guessing it’s talking about the whole cylinder.

Read full topic
